intro: Ratonia martyana, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a striking plant native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five petals, often arranged in a star-like pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
